Package com.deco2800.game.areas.rooms

Class MapRoom

java.lang.Object
com.deco2800.game.areas.rooms.MapRoom
public class MapRoom
extends java.lang.Object
Represents a 'room' inside a 'house'. Is a discrete section of a game level's map. Stores information that can be used for map generation. TODO need to separate walls and floor textures maybe? Could have walls be symbols specified on the perimeter

    • getRoomBounds

      public GridPoint2[] getRoomBounds()
      Get the positions of bounding corners for the room.
      Returns:
      Two gridpoints, representing opposing corners of the room.

    • isInBounds

      public boolean isInBounds​(int x, int y)
      Check if a given x and y coordinate are within the bounds of the room.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of position to check.
      y - Y coordinate of position to check.
      Returns:
      True if the position is within room bounds. False otherwise.

    • isInBounds

      public boolean isInBounds​(GridPoint2 pos)
      Check if a given position is within the bounds of the room.
      Parameters:
      pos - Position to check.
      Returns:
      True if the position is within room bounds. False otherwise.

    • getSymbolsToPaths

      public java.util.HashMap<GridPoint2,​java.lang.String> getSymbolsToPaths()
      Get a map of texture positions to texture paths, rather than texture symbols.
      Returns:
      A map of grid point to the path for a given texture.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Convert the map room object into a string for textual representation. The string representation is the room's dimensions, then offset, then the number of textures defined for that room, including the two base textures. E.g. A 2 by 4 room at (0, 0) with 2 defined textures: "(2, 4); (0, 0); Textures: 2"
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the map room objects.
